_header: A friar an hayward a fox and a fulmar sitting on a row
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 11.

BodTan407.Transcription:
A fryer an hetward afox and afulmer sittyng on a rewea tapster hym
                    sittyng by to fylle þe cumpany þe best is astrewe
BodTan407.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Middle English Lyrics: Handlist of New Texts.” 
             Anglia
         83 (1965): 35-47: 44.

BLAdd60577.Transcription:
A ffox and a fullymert a frere & a haywarde stondynge on a roweA
                    tapyster stondynge þem by þe beste of þe company ys ane olde
                    schrewe
BLAdd60577.Note:
Trans. ‘Vulpe et fetoncro et inclusario stantibus
                    seriatim…’, which follows.
BLAdd60577.Facsimiles:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981.
